title: Graph Neural Network-Based Modeling for Knowledge Graph Completion

context.prior_knowledge: Linear algebra, probability theory, machine learning fundamentals, and basic graph theory
context.additional_context: Class emphasizing discussion and collaborative learning through hands-on practice in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the structural characteristics and incompleteness issues of knowledge graphs from a mathematical perspective
Learners can perform practical analysis of hidden relational patterns within knowledge graphs using GCN-based models
Learners can compare relational correlations and multidimensional feature extraction techniques in multi-relational graph modeling
Learners can design experiments to evaluate independence between feature groups by applying mutual information minimization techniques
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
